results.title: Cargo handling at the ports
results.creator_credit: Air Ministry and Great Britain. Ministry of Transport
results.brief_description: Deals with the equipment used in the handling of ships’ cargoes. Among the mechanical appliances shown are various types of crane, pick-up devices, hoppers, conveyors to transport goods from holds to railway trucks, grain elevators, floating elevators, motor tractors and trailers, electric tractors, fork-lift trucks, elevating trucks, the Ross carrier, and power-operated truck mover. Demonstrates how this equipment enables goods to be handled more quickly, so increasing the capacity of the docks.

results.title: A Career in bricklaying
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film emphasizes the positive aspects of work in bricklaying. As in most career films the less-favourable side of the work is omitted. Bricklayers are shown learning the trade, and the application of bricklaying skills is depicted in various constructions including ornamental brickwork, arches, and brickwork in high-rise buildings. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Care of the skin
results.brief_description: Encourages cleanliness by showing the daily grooming rituals of three children: Fred, Billy and Virginia. Portrays children as they prepare for bed, showing the proper way to wash hands and face and to bathe. Common skin ailments are illustrated. Animated diagrams describe the structure of the skin and explain why soap is necessary for cleanliness.

results.title: Care of the newborn baby
results.creator_credit: John A. Haeseler, United States. Dept. of Education and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description: Instructs parents in the care, feeding, and bathing of a newborn baby, introducing the prenatal clinic where instruction is given to expectant mothers, the hospital or nursing home, and the district nurse who visits the mother after the baby is born.

results.title: Care of the feet
results.creator_credit: Dudley J. Morton and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents the structural elements of the foot as a weight-supporting structure; how walking is accomplished; depicts causes of structural foot ailments, and suggests remedies; shows other kinds of foot ailments and their diagnosis and treatment.

results.title: Care of the cardiac patient
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Willard Pictures
results.brief_description: Presents a complete case history of a typical cardiac patient from the initial attack and treatment to rehabilitation and return to a useful home life. The nursing care given to the patient includes comfort, rest, sleep, diet, feeding, elimination, cleanliness, and diversional and occupational therapy.

results.title: The Care of the aged
results.brief_description: The problems of old people who have lived through two world wars, are often passed over by an industrial society. How do they live? Germany attempts to improve their lives by providing homes, entertainment, and other social services.
